summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Dallas City Board of Adjustment will hold a briefing and public hearing on November 20, 2024, at 10:30 A.M., followed by a public hearing at 1:00 P.M. The meeting will take place at Dallas City Hall, Room 6ES, and will be accessible via videoconference. The purpose of the meeting is to discuss various applications for zoning variances and special exceptions, as well as to hear public testimony.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
The agenda includes a staff presentation, public hearing, and public testimony. Key topics involve reviewing uncontested items, holdover cases, and individual cases related to zoning regulations.

**Important Details**:  
Significant proposals include requests for fee waivers for special exceptions to fence height and visibility obstruction regulations, variances to building height regulations, and interpretations of zoning district boundaries. Notable applications include:
- BDA234-155_FR1: Fee waiver request for fence regulations at 929 Brookwood Drive.
- BDA234-133: Variance request for building height at 3434 Altamoore Drive.
- BDA234-138: Special exceptions for visibility obstruction at 1415 Corto Drive.

**Action Items**:  
The Board is seeking approval for the minutes from previous meetings and will deliberate on the various applications presented. Decisions will be made regarding the approval of fee waivers, variances, and special exceptions as outlined in the agenda. Public input will be considered before final decisions are rendered.
